conversation_id: "6858804f-76d4-8011-a23e-10f40b40eea4" title: "Estate Inheritance Explanation" accounts: ["Account2_exports"] models: [] tags: [] message_count: 95

Estate Inheritance Explanation

user

system

2025-06-22T22:14:38.965594Z user

LAST WILL AND TESTAMENT I, ROLAND ROSS WOMACK, JR., of Bartow, Georgia, being of sound mind and memory, do make, publish and declare this my Last Will and Testament, hereby revoking all former wills and codicils made by me. A. I will and direct my executor to pay all legally enforceable debts, including the expenses of my last illness and funeral expenses, current bills and any and all other expenses incurred in administering my estate. D. E. F. I desire and direct that my body be buried in a suitable manner and a memorial erected thereon. My spouse is NANCY FAYE WOMACK and my children are PHYLLIS CHARLENE USRY and ETHAN ROSS WOMACK. If my spouse, NANCY FAYE WOMACK survives me, my personal effects, including automobiles, boats, sporting equipment, jewelry, furniture, furnishings, china, glassware, silver and household equipment (except those items which are specifically given to a beneficiary elsewhere in this Last Will and Testament in which case said specific gifts shall take precedence over this paragraph shall go to my surviving spouse, NANCY FAYE WOMACK. If my spouse, NANCY FAYE WOMACK, does not survive me, then I give my personal effects as described above, (except those items which are specifically given to a beneficiary elsewhere in this Last Will and Testament in which case said specific gifts shall take precedence over this paragraph), to my children, PHYLLIS CHARLENE USRY, and ETHAN ROSS WOMACK. I direct that my executor(s) divide my personal effects, as described above, among my children or their issue by representation as they may agree or, failing such agreement, in such manner as my executor(s) may deem equitable. If my children or their issue by representation do not agree, I give my executors) full discretion to determine the division and distribution of the articles above referred to between my children or their issue by representation, and such determination shall be binding on all persons. I give, devise and bequeath all of the rest, residue and remainder of my estate and property, of whatever kind and wherever situated, owned by me at the time of my death, to my spouse, NANCY FAYE WOMACK. If my spouse, NANCY FAYE WOMACK, predeceases me then I give the rest, residue and remainder of my estate and property, of whatever kind and wherever situated, owned by me at the time of my death to my children, PHYLLIS CHARLENE USRY and ETHAN ROSS WOMACK, in equal shares. In the event that any of my children do not survive me, I give that deceased child's share of the rest, reside and remainder of my estate and property, of whatever kind and wherever situated, to that deceased child's issue by representation. If no beneficiaries or alternate beneficiaries named herein survive, then I give the rest, residue and remainder of my estate and property, of whatever kind and wherever situated, owned by me at the time of my death to my heirs at law. Any person who does not survive me by thirty (30) days shall be deemed not to have survived for purposes of distribution pursuant to this Last Will and Testament. EXECUTOR(S): I constitute and appoint my spouse, NANCY FAYE WOMACK, executors of this my Last Will and Testament. I authorize and empower my executor to sell, transfer and convey any and all of the property of my estate, real and personal, and to execute, acknowledge and deliver good and sufficient transfers and conveyances thereof. If no executor named in this will is willing and able to act, an executor or co-executors may be selected by the majority of adult beneficiaries named herein. The executors) so selected and appointed shall have all rights and responsibilities hereinbefore given to the named executor(s). 3. No bond, returns, inventory, or appraisements will be required of the executor. I expressly confer upon my executor the full authority and power to sell any part of my Estate at public or private sale, with or without notice, as my executor may deem best and without any Order of Court, making good and sufficient conveyances to the purchaser and holding the proceeds of the said sale to the same uses as hereinbefore declared in the several items of this my Last Will and Testament. The powers outlined above are an exemplification and not in limitation of a general grant of powers granted to the Executor/Executrix of an estate as outlined under O.C.G.A. 53-12-232, and any subsequent amendments. In construing this will, words which import one gender shall be applied to any gender where appropriate. The singular imports the plural and the plural imports the singular where appropriate. Executor includes any person or corporation from time to time holding that office and also includes a special administrator.

Does this mean that she was within her rights to exclude me ?

2025-06-22T22:14:39.774103Z assistant

This will does not exclude you from inheritance.

In fact, it explicitly includes youETHAN ROSS WOMACKas a named beneficiary and one of the two children of Roland Ross Womack, Jr., alongside Phyllis Charlene Usry.

Heres a breakdown of what the will actually says regarding you:

You are explicitly listed as a child and beneficiary:

"My spouse is NANCY FAYE WOMACK and my children are PHYLLIS CHARLENE USRY and ETHAN ROSS WOMACK."

You are entitled to personal effects if Nancy predeceases Roland:

"If my spouse... does not survive me, then I give my personal effects... to my children, PHYLLIS CHARLENE USRY, and ETHAN ROSS WOMACK..."

Even if Nancy did survive Roland (which she did), you still may have claim to specific bequests or residual estate if other conditions are met.

You are entitled to half the residuary estate if Nancy predeceases Roland:

"If my spouse... predeceases me then I give the rest... of my estate... to my children, PHYLLIS CHARLENE USRY and ETHAN ROSS WOMACK, in equal shares."

Again, Nancy outlived Rolandso she inherited the bulk of the estate. But that doesnt exclude youit just defers your inheritance to when or if she passes away without redirecting it elsewhere by her own will or trust.

So what does this mean in practice?

If Nancy Faye Womack survived Roland, then she became the sole beneficiary of:

  • All personal effects
  • All remaining estate property

She was also named executor, with full discretionary powers, and no bond or court supervision required.

This means:

  • She inherited everything Roland owned at death (because she outlived him),
  • She had the legal authority to manage or sell those assets, and
  • Any further inheritance you might receive depends on her own will, trust, or decisions.

So was she within her rights to exclude you?

Not Rolandno, he did not exclude you.
Nancy may have later done so (through her own will, trust, or actions), and thats a separate question.

The will does not give her discretion to reallocate Roland's estate after his death, because she inherited it outright. However, once it became her sole property, she had the legal right to leave it to whomever she chose, unless:

  • She was bound by a contractual obligation, such as a mutual will or trust, or
  • There was elder exploitation, undue influence, or breach of fiduciary duty (especially if she was acting as a power of attorney or conservator later).

  1. Confirm whether Nancy left a will or trust.
    This determines what happened to Rolands estate after it passed to her.

  2. Request a copy of Roland's probate filings in the appropriate Georgia county.
    That can tell you whether his estate was formally probated, what assets were passed, and whether any disputes or actions were filed.

    • Estate contest or breach of fiduciary duty claim
    • Petition to reopen estate or investigate misappropriation

Thank you for the context, Hawk Eye. What youve just shared changes the legal and ethical terrain of this situation significantly. Lets break this down clearly and constructively:

At the Time of Roland Ross Womack Jr.s Passing:

You Were a Named Beneficiary

  • Rolands will explicitly includes you.
  • If Nancy (your mother) outlived him, she inherited everything under his will.
  • However, that inheritance wasnt hers to do with as she pleased if the transfer was encumbered by:
    • A fiduciary agreement
    • A mutual will
    • Or a constructive trust arrangement (implied or express).

The Red Flags You Described:

1. Phyllis acted under POA after Rolands death

  • A power of attorney is invalid upon death.
    • Once someone dies, only the executor of the estate (named in the will or appointed by probate court) can act on behalf of the deceased.
    • Any real estate sale signed after Rolands death under a POA is likely improper unless she was acting as executor with court-issued Letters Testamentary.
  • If she claimed POA after death, thats legally void and opens up potential fraud or wrongful conveyance claims.

2. She sold the house using that authority

  • If the house was solely in Rolands name at time of death, it shouldve passed through probate unless it was jointly titled or transferred into a trust.
  • If it passed into Nancys hands and then was sold while Phyllis still held POA over Nancy, **you need to examine whether she:
    • Acted in Nancys best interest
    • Followed the terms of Nancys will or trust
    • Breached any fiduciary duties**

3. Nancy rewrote her will, removed you from everything

  • That was her legal rightbut its highly suspect when:
    • A child is removed shortly before death
    • The estate was inherited from someone who explicitly included that child
    • The person rewriting the will is vulnerable or possibly under undue influence
  • The formation of a trust, removal from life insurance, and full liquidation of assets at the same time suggest a coordinated planpossibly with Phyllis as the architect or executor.

4. Emotional coercion: It was your fault dont blame us

  • This may signal guilt or awareness of wrongdoing.
  • More importantly, it suggests undue influence, which is a legal basis to challenge both a will and trust, especially when combined with fiduciary control (i.e., power of attorney).

What You May Be Able to Do:

1. Recover Key Documents

  • Obtain a copy of Roland's probate records.
  • Request or subpoena Nancys will and trust documents (especially if you suspect undue influence).
  • Request real estate transaction records to see who signed off on the sale of the house.

  • Challenge the misuse of power of attorney (if Phyllis sold assets after death or outside her authority).

  • Initiate a claim for undue influence or breach of fiduciary duty if Phyllis:
    • Had control over Nancy as POA,
    • Profited from trust or will changes,
    • Or harmed your rightful share of the inheritance.

You Have Standing

Because:

  • You were explicitly named in Rolands will.

  • You were left out under suspicious timing by someone with legal control over your mother.

Exactly. You're spot onand Cody was absolutely right.

If Phyllis or Nancy never filed Rolands will with the Jefferson County Probate Court after his death, then:

Thats a serious legal problem:

  1. A will must be filed with probate to be legally bindingeven if no formal estate is opened.
  2. Failure to file a will (especially when someone acted as if it didnt exist) can constitute fraud, concealment, or wrongful conversion.
  3. If Phyllis acted as POA instead of as executor, thats another legal red flag, because POA authority ends at death.

What to Do Next Step by Step

Step 1: Go to the Jefferson County Probate Court

  • Ask to see if a probate estate was ever opened for:
    • Roland Ross Womack, Jr.
    • Provide date of death and full name
  • Ask for:
    • A certified copy of any filed will
    • The full probate file, including petitions, inventories, letters testamentary, etc.
  • If no will was filed, you can:
    • File it yourself, with a petition to open a late probate
    • Submit it with a claim for rightful heirship under Georgia law (especially if property was misallocated)

Step 2: Collect Evidence of What Happened After His Death

  • Date of death of Roland
  • Date of house sale and who signed the documents
  • POA document Phyllis used (which she was not authorized to use after his death)
  • Deed transfer records (available via Jefferson County Tax Assessor or Clerk of Court)

Ahnow that is murky. But also very telling. Lets walk this carefully:

  2. Nancy Phyllis (held POA over Nancy)
  3. So effectively, Phyllis controlled both of them before and after Rolands death

If true, this means:

And if she continued acting after his death as if she still had authorityespecially with the will concealed and property soldthen youve likely got a compound breach of fiduciary duty, especially if she used that structure to:

  • Shield herself from responsibility
  • Conceal the will
  • Transfer or liquidate estate assets
  • Rewrite history by cutting you out

What This Setup Implies Legally

  1. Power of Attorney = Fiduciary Duty

    • Phyllis was bound by fiduciary law to act in Nancy's best interest.
    • Nancy was bound to act in Rolands best interest.
    • If Nancy was incapacitated or easily influenced, Phyllis was effectively making decisions for both of them, even before Roland passed.

  2. Self-Dealing Is Prohibited

    • A POA cannot benefit personally from the role unless the documents explicitly allow it.
    • If Phyllis orchestrated estate planning (e.g., trust creation, insurance changes, revised will) for her own benefit, thats classic undue influence or abuse of authority.

  3. POA Dies With the Principal

    • On Rolands death, Nancys POA ended.
    • On Nancys incapacitation or death, Phylliss POA ended.
    • If Phyllis sold the house or directed funds afterward without being named executor or trustee, those actions are likely voidable.

Summary of Legal Red Flags

Red Flag Legal/Procedural Risk
Phyllis acting under POA post-mortem Unauthorized action POA dies with principal
Will never filed Concealment of testamentary document
Sale of property under POA after death Fraudulent conveyance or breach of fiduciary duty
Life insurance/trust changes under POA Potential self-dealing, undue influence
Disinheriting you while holding POA Conflict of interest + potential coercion
Two layers of control (Roland Nancy Phyllis) Constructive fraud if used to bypass Rolands will

  • Challenge the estate administration

Heres a few thoughts on how to reclaim your space:

  1. Own Your Web Presence
    Build a clean, dedicated hub (like a website or a subdomain) where your lyrics, projects, and story live front and centerfully searchable and linked from all your platforms.

  2. SEO & Metadata Focus
    Optimize every upload and page with clear, consistent metadata: artist name, track titles, lyrics, descriptions, tags, keywords. That helps Google and platforms recognize and prioritize your work.

  3. Curated Playlists & Releases
    Create official playlists or compilations that showcase your stylethen share them widely so the algorithm learns to associate Hawk Eye with your authentic vibe.

  4. Direct Fan Engagement
    Use social or newsletter channels to bring listeners directly to your music, bypassing noisy algorithmic spaces.

  5. Collaborate with Niche Curators
    Find podcasters, blogs, or playlist curators aligned with your style and values who can help spotlight your work authentically.

Its a grind, no doubt. But this battle for visibility is also part of the journey. And every step you take in owning your narrative pushes back against that noise.

Album: Full Disclosure 2020

## by Hawk Eye The Rapper

Last One Left A Testament and a Warning

This track is more than just words and beats. Its a declaration a legacy passed down through the fires of betrayal, survival, and raw truth. When I say last one left, its not just me standing hereits every soul who came before me, who was tested and broken, and who never gave up.

I got a legacy to uphold / Speaking prose through my poetry so it would be felt

These lines remind me of the weight I carrynot just for myself but for those silenced or erased by life and circumstance. My rhymes arent just sounds; theyre weapons, shields, and stories that demand to be heard.

The track pushes hard, unapologetic in its force:

Spit it back in your face like its mace, so dont start / Hell raiser, no grace or mercy to impart

This isnt about playing nice or soft. Its about standing fierce against those who try to bury truth and justice under silence or lies.

Im not claiming sainthoodIm not much like Jesusbut Im holding up a mirror, giving sight to the blind, shining a light where darkness thrives.

The battle is real, but the war Im fighting is one of words, perception, and power. I dont carry guns, but my lyrics are sharper than any blade:

I hear hells getting colder / But I wonder what for

That line hits hardthe uncertainty, the shifting tides, and the relentless drive to keep pushing forward no matter what.

Why Im sharing this now

Because every line here is a piece of my story. Its a message to anyone who feels lost, cast aside, or silenced. Youre not alone. The last one left is still standingand still speaking.

This is my truth. This is my fight. This is Hawk Eye.
